name: Healthyfied Tuna In Citrus Soy Sauce
description: Healthify your meals with this Healthyfied Tuna in Citrus Soy Sauce recipe. Rich in protein and low in carbs and sugar, it's an ideal choice for anyone looking to maintain a balanced diet without sacrificing flavor. This delicious recipe brings together the freshness of calamondin with the savory depth of low-sodium soy sauce, presenting a dish that exudes culinary sophistication while adhering to healthy eating principles. Perfect for the health-conscious food lover!

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the white onion and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water to create a slurry. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Juice the calamondin to get the required amount of juice. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onion and saut√© until translucent, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Add the frozen tuna cubes to the skillet and cook until they are evenly browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the low sodium soy sauce, calamondin juice, the remaining water (6 fl oz), and salt. Bring to a simmer.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cornstarch slurry to the skillet. Stir constantly until the sauce thickens, about 2-3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Season with ground black pepper. Simmer for an additional 2 minutes to blend the flavors.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
